meanings.definition: Capable of being executed or carried out.
meanings.sent1: The plan was executable, so we decided to proceed with it.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were clear and executable, making the task easy to complete.
meanings.sent3: His idea to build a treehouse in one day was certainly executable, but quite ambitious.
meanings.sent4: Her vision for the project was so executable that it inspired everyone to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The recipe was so executable that even beginners could follow it successfully.

meanings.definition: A file that can be run or executed by a computer.
meanings.sent1: I downloaded the executable and installed it on my computer.
meanings.sent2: The software developer created an executable that simplified the task.
meanings.sent3: The executable seemed to have a mind of its own, opening and closing randomly.
meanings.sent4: The executable functioned like a well-oiled machine, performing tasks seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The executable contained all the necessary code to run the program smoothly.
